result.execSummary:
The defendant Joray M. Ledin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland immediatly after release from Ashland County Jail!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: Payment plan $30 per month beginning 1 month after release from Ashland County Jail

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Comply with any other counseling as directed by the DOC at no cost to Ashalnd County

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail
NO CONTACT WITH KATIE PAFFEL
NO CONTACT WITH ANTHONY WESTLUND
NO CONTACT WITH MICHAEL TRAPP
No contact with known drug dealers/users except in group therapy.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Ct begins with SAR sentencing 15CF244 ct 1 1yr jail,Ct3 1 yr co jail cc. 16CF51 120 days jail cs to 16Cf244 and 16CF137. 16CF137 1yr each count CC with one another. Fin obl civil judg. 17CF103 ct 1 9 mo jail IS 1 yr prob, Ct3 3yrs 6 mo 1 1/2yr in 2 yr es with imposed and stayed 3yr prob.

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Joray M. Ledin in court. with atty   Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF244,16CF51,16CF137,17CF103,17CM62. Ct rec'd PQ and recommendation. Contested SEH.  17CF103--Understands charges and potential penalties. PLEADS NC. admits Count 2 is a repeater . 17CM62 is DRI. Signed PQ, understands elements. Wants Ct to accept pleas, Def had brain injury, atty explained things to def so that he understood. CT accepts pleas and finds G. --CT rev'd Criminal record on 4th page of states recommendation. ADA has no opposition . didn't think it was needed. Atty thinks he can make a determination. Ct comments DOC neutral  party. Ct comments PSI. -- in 17CF103 only- short form, 2 weeks before hearing have it due. no author.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2017 at 11:00 am.
STATE'S RECOMMENDATION FOR SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION & PLEA AGREEMENT and STATE'S SENTENCING RECOMMENDATION

Defendant Joray M. Ledin in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Ruth Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. STC on 17CM62 and 17CF103, scheduling on 16CF137,51 and 15CF244. STC, Atty Hughes will likely be accepting recommendation, asks for hearing for both plea and sentencing and SAR, parties are not asking for PSI.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2017 at 12:00 pm.

Defendant Joray M. Ledin in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA agreement reached. Off record for def to speak with atty. to Ct from Casie Ledin

Defendant Joray M. Ledin in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waives reading and stands mute.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 11:15 am

Defendant Joray M. Ledin in court by video with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann appr in person.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rec comp, waives reading, waives prelim. Ct finds prob cause, bond over. 15CM255 def atty comments on no contact condition with Casey Ledin, she is requesting to have this lifted. Has other open cases (total of 4 cases open) others scheduled for 1:45pm 6/6. Atty Hoffmann, advises status is that there is an offer asks for PLEAS and ARGN at same time. 16CF137 ARGN 6/27 1:15, STC on other cases. Currently on probation hold with revocation, there is no motion for modification filed in writing. DA comments does not see that the bail condition exists, Atty Hoffmann, may be set by probation agent.  Ct finds condition, No contact with CL unless completely sober. Victim Casey Ledin addresses court, Mary Pliss told her that she was not to have contact. Ct gives Casey Ledin copy of bail condition, IF this is an order of probation seperate. Ct contacts Mary Pliss (on 15CM255), ct advises def of BB condition, she was not aware of the condition. DOC has ordered NO Contact with Casey Ledin. PO says if he wishes to request No Contact be lifted he needs to put in writing.  Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also cases 15CF244 and 15CM255. DAP, bond continues  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
